alert.note: Alert for Champaign (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Champaign County through 415 AM CDT... At 345 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Thomasboro, or 8 miles southwest of Rantoul, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Thomasboro around 350 AM CDT. Rantoul around 355 AM CDT. St. Joseph and Gifford around 400 AM CDT. Ogden around 405 AM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 236 and 251. Interstate 74 between mile markers 173 and 197. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for east central Illinois.
